column2: CALIFORNIA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. It is against the law to enter an intersection when:
column4: the light is yellow and you can stop safely.
column6: you can’t get all the way across before the light turns red.
column8: the light is flashing yellow and you didn’t stop first.

column2: 2. If your vehicle starts to lose traction because of water on the road:
column4: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column6: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
column8: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

column2: 3. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Stop.
column6: Slow down.
column8: Yield.

column2: 4. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column4: on the right.
column6: directly behind them.
column8: on the front.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 6. Which of the following is true about large trucks:
column4: Trucks often appear to travel slower because of their large size.
column6: It is best to pass trucks very slowly and on the right side.
column8: Trucks have fewer blind spots due to the vehicle’s height.

column2: 7. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.
column8: a shared lane starts ahead.

column2: 8. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Call the police.
column6: Do not panic.
column8: Run away.

column2: 9. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Area reserved for people with disabilities
column6: Hospital service
column8: Interstate highway

column2: 10. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
column6: of a steering failure.
column8: of a brake failure.

column2: 11. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column6: exclusively for stop signs.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 12. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Rely on your mirrors.
column6: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 13. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: white rectangles.
column6: green rectangles.
column8: white triangles.

column2: 14. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 16. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 18. You are getting ready to make a right turn. You should:
column4: signal during the last 100 feet before you turn.
column6: always stop before making a right turn.
column8: slow down and signal as you start your turn.

column2: 19. When should you use hand-over-hand steering?
column4: When performing sharp right turns.
column6: When parking.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 20. The yellow sign means:
column4: You are approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.
column8: Railroad crossing is controlled - continue at your regular speed.

column2: 21. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.

column2: 22. To pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching:
column4: wait until the oncoming vehicle passes the bicyclist.
column6: sound your horn, then pass the bicyclist.
column8: slow down and let the vehicle pass before passing the bicyclist.

column2: 23. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Vertical rectangle
column6: Round
column8: Pentagon

column2: 24. You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement:
column4: if you are involved in a collision or stopped for a citation.
column6: only if you are involved in a collision.
column8: only if you are stopped and cited.

column2: 25. You are driving 55 MPH on a two-lane highway, one lane in each direction, and want to pass the vehicle ahead of you. To pass safely, you need to:
column4: wait until solid double, yellow lines separate the lanes.
column6: have a large enough gap in the oncoming traffic.
column8: increase your speed to at least 60 MPH.

column2: 26. You may legally drive in any freeway carpool lane if:
column4: all other lanes are stopped with heavy traffic.
column6: you carry the minimum number of persons shown on the sign.
column8: it is between the hours of 7pm and 7am.

column2: 27. To eliminate or reduce air bag risk, drivers should ride at least ________ from the air bag cover.
column4: 20 inches
column6: 10 inches
column8: 2 inches

column2: 28. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: Never.
column6: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 29. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 30. It is extremely foggy. Based on the Basic Speed Law, if you are driving 45 MPH in a 55 MPH speed, you could be cited for:
column4: driving “too fast for conditions.”
column6: driving below the posted Basic Speed Limit.
column8: driving too slow.

column2: 31. You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 MPH. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 MPH. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely:
column4: 30 MPH
column6: 65 MPH
column8: 35 MPH

column2: 32. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: school crossings.
column6: no passing zones.
column8: possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 33. You may make a left turn on a red light only from a:
column4: two-way street onto a one-way street.
column6: one-way street onto a two-way street.
column8: one-way street onto a one-way street.

column2: 34. Before driving into an intersection from a stop, you should look:
column4: left, right, and left again.
column6: straight ahead and to the left.
column8: left and right.

column2: 35. You should dim your lights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle:
column4: you have already passed.
column6: approaching you from behind.
column8: you are approaching from behind.

column2: 36. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
